meanings.definition: The act or process of converting something back to its original form or state.
meanings.sent1: The reconversions of old buildings into modern apartments brought new life to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The reconversions of the files from digital to paper format took longer than expected.
meanings.sent3: After many reconversions, the puzzle pieces finally fit together perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The reconversions of the garden transformed it into a colorful paradise.
meanings.sent5: The reconversions of the old car made it look brand new.

meanings.definition: The process of changing one's beliefs or religion back to a previous state.
meanings.sent1: Her reconversions to her childhood beliefs brought her peace and comfort.
meanings.sent2: The reconversions of the community members to their traditional religion were celebrated with a feast.
meanings.sent3: His frequent reconversions between different beliefs left his friends confused.
meanings.sent4: The reconversions of the students to their original faith were met with understanding and support.
meanings.sent5: The reconversions of the family to their ancestral religion strengthened their bond.
